intro: Asarca dasypogon, commonly known as the rough-leaved asarum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often hidden among the foliage. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
